cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the south-central Louisiana coast, then expected to turn north and move up the Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast near the Intracoastal City/Morgan City area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches extend from the mouth of the Mississippi River westward to Cameron, LA and eastward to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge warnings from Intracoastal City to Grand Isle, LA with tropical-storm warnings eastward to the mouth of the Pearl River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Texas eastward to Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤7%) of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; most winds expected to remain below gale force
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Upper Texas Coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–2 inches of rain, locally higher, but widespread heavy totals are not anticipated
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated Gulf swells and rip currents may affect vessel approach lanes and pilot boarding areas
